str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From zelos; to have warmth of feeling for or against.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I take to myself, (b) I take aside, (c) I welcome. From pros and lambano; to take to oneself, i.e. Use, lead, admit.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Evil, bad, wicked, malicious, slothful.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agora; relating to the market-place, i.e. Forensic; by implication, vulgar.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To gather a crowd, make a riot. From ochlos and poieo; to make a crowd, i.e. Raise a public disturbance.

word: [and] sent the city into an uproar.
parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From thorubos; to be in tumult, i.e. Disturb, clamor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.
Future active participle masculine of iaomai; about to cure; Jason, a Christian.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From pro and ago; to lead forward; intransitively, to precede (participle, previous).
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From deo; the public.
